isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992 - 1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ENGINE ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE (ECM)

svcproc.title: ENGINE ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE (ECM)
svcproc.para: The ECM receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is on.

Battery power (12 volt) to the ECM is supplied from the starter terminals to the ECM on circuits 97 and 97A. The ECM ground circuit to the starter is circuit 97-G. There are two Cummins 10 AMP fuses in the circuit between the power connector and the ECM. Refer to Battery Power To ECM Test for an illustration of this circuit.
With the ignition key switch in the IGN position, ignition power is supplied through F28 fuse to the ECM 9-way connector to the ECM.
